Do the dreamchaser built-in docking ports dock with the APAS? In my old version I had to Offset an APAS over the rear docking port, and I never used the front port

The rear dockports have been remodeled, centered and fully functioning and now dock up to standard dock ports.

The animated front ports are fully functional, remodeled to add nodes, and docks up to small dock ports.

All axis rcs now working, and extra mono added and isp increased

Thanks

- - - Updated - - -

(Yes it will connect to apas and other iss ports)

Thank you, Sir!

On the Dreamer docking issue, MechJeb doesn't recognize it as a docking node and thinks it's rotated 180 degrees. Not a criticial issue (it just gives you a nag reminding you that it's not a docking port), just an annoyance. I suspect replacing it with an APAS port will fix it, and that's something I can do in the VAB.
I will look into it. Maybe node naming issues or something. Thanks
Probably one of the "allow ____________" switches. I had to edit one of those to allow the node you added to the JEM PLM to properly attach to a launcher.

new iss/soviet update is up. includes iss craft file.

http://i.imgur.com/bRzuyNo.png

Hey Mike, some gripes about this picture. First, at this point in the station's life, Zarya (and I think Zvesda)had retracted its/their solar panels as they were no longer being needed! The truss with the giant solar panels was the sole source of power on the station!

Hey Mike, some gripes about this picture. First, at this point in the station's life, Zarya (and I think Zvesda)had retracted its/their solar panels as they were no longer being needed! The truss with the giant solar panels was the sole source of power on the station!

Yes Zarya retracted it's solar arrays (partially), but Zvesda's arrays are deployed to this day.

Anyone want patch for the bobcat american pack?

What's included in that pack?

Anyone want patch for the bobcat american pack?

Yes!!!

American Pack

Features:

A full replica of the Lunar phase of the Constellation project.

The early version of the Orion spacecraft, with circular solar panels by Yogui.

Altair Munar lander, with working landing legs (NOTE: Add landing legs to "gear" group manually if you want "G" to trigger them).

Detailed IVAs visible from the outside.

LER rover with wheels that can rotate to the side for increased mobility.

An LRV prototype, mostly functional, can fold.

Two heavy-lift rockets. Ares I for Orion and Ares V for cargo (including Altair).
